exam_overview.typical_completion_time: 12 to 18 months (if passing both levels consecutively)

level_1.name: CAIA Level I
level_1.delivery: Prometric testing centers (online proctored available only by approved accommodation)

level_2.name: CAIA Level II
level_2.description: Advanced topics focusing on portfolio construction, due diligence, and advanced tools
level_2.exam_format: Multiple choice questions and constructed response (essay) sections
level_2.delivery: Prometric testing centers (online proctored available only by approved accommodation)

curriculum.update_frequency: Annually (released in October for the following year)

level_1: Deeper Digital Assets coverage (institutional portfolio roles, risk frameworks, allocation philosophy)
Revised content around fees & expenses to clarify impact on net performance
level_2: Stronger content on Rebalancing Strategies, especially where portfolios include illiquid or alternative assets
Advanced sections on Digital Assets: specifically crypto trading & investing, and unique risks in crypto markets
New 'Emerging Topics' readings: e.g., historical performance of private market funds & case studies from pension plans using direct investments

enrollment_fee.description: One-time, non-refundable enrollment fee for first-time Level I candidates (also applies for Level II in the stackable program)

retake_fee.description: Applies regardless of level or reason for retake

membership.requirements: Pass Level II and accumulate relevant work experience

trends.level_1: Pass rates have been declining in recent years

results_timing.level_1: Within ~5 weeks after the final exam day
results_timing.level_2: About 8 weeks (due to essay/constructed response sections)

eligibility.prerequisites: Foundational knowledge in finance and statistics recommended

study_materials.note: Updated annually; prior editions are not recommended
study_materials.additional_resources: Various third-party study providers offer supplementary materials
